Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Zs-CATH (cathelicidin; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: skin, the tree frog,Zhangixalus smaragdinus, China, Asia

Literature.Author: He Y, Shen Y, Feng X, Ruan S, Zhao Y, Mu L, Wu J, Yang H. 2023
Literature.Title: Tree Frog-Derived Cathelicidin Protects Mice against Bacterial Infection through Its Antimicrobial and Anti-Inflammatory Activities and Regulatory Effect on Phagocytes.

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: sequence homology with cathelicidin.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (66.67%) tofrog cathelicidin HR-CATHK: 24%. pI: 10.49; GRAVY: -0.0818; Mol Wt: 3602.457; Mol formula: C159H283N47O40S3; Mol Ex coeff:  125.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or 1780 (MIC 18.75-37.5 ug/ml), A. junii ATCC 17908 (MIC 4.69 ug/ml), A. faecalis 13A154089 (MIC 9.38 ug/ml), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 18.75 ug/ml), and B. subtilis (MIC 9.38 ug/ml).In vitro toxicity: not toxic to rabbit and murine RBC and mammalian cells at 180 ug/ml.Structure: helical in SDS.Animal model:mouse: it protected mice from E. coli or S. aureus infection.
